data.title: Ferdinand II of Aragon V of Spain

Ferdinand II of Aragon V of Spain

Born: March 10, 1452 in Sos Aragon

Father: King John II of Aragon

Mother: Juana Enriquez

Married 1: Isabella of Castile

Children 1:

Joanna the Mad

Catherine of Aragon

Married 2: Germaine de Foix, a niece of Louis XII of France

Children 2:

A son that died in 1509.

Life:

Also known as Ferdinand the Catholic, king of Castile and Leon in Spain.

1461 His father named him as govenor of his kingdoms.

1468 Named the king of Sicily.

1469 Married Isabella of Castile, combining two kingdoms and was the first unification of Spain.

1474 Henry IV of Castile died, Isabella claimed the throne in Segovia with Ferdinand her husband.

1479 won a war against Afonso V of Portugal, who also claimed the throne.

1478 established the Spanish Inquisition, to expel all Jews that would not accept the Catholic Religion. As a result they lost many wealthy and powerful citizens.

1479 Ferdinand became king of Aragon.

They succeeded in breaking the power of the nobles and took their land.

They banned all religions except Roman Catholic.

The pope honored them with the right to appoint high officials in the chruch.

1482 Started a war against Muslims in Granada.

1492 The Granada war ended and through Christopher Columbus, who they supported, they made claim to colonies in America.

1504 Isabella died, and the older children had died, so the throne was to be left to Joan the Mad. Ferdinand married Germaine de Foix, a niece of Louis XII of France.

1516 Ferdinand was thus ruled over Castile until his death. The crowns of all the Spanish kingdoms passed on to his grandson, Charles I, ruler of the Netherlands and heir to the Holy Roman Empire as Charles V.
